etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From German Propargyl from prop- (in Propyl) + arg- (in classical Latin argentum silver, with reference to the fact that the radical was first detected in a silver compound precipitated from solution) + -yl

definitions: An unsaturated hydrocarbon radical related to propyne; 2-propynyl. Usually attributive or a formative element in chemical names.
